name: Holiday Inn Guildford

reviews.text: We booked into a Family Room because it worked out nicely for our Thorpe Park visit.
reviews.title: Good Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My first impression of the place was good because of the friendly staff. We were given the keys but weren't offered help with our luggage. There was 4 of us staying and I thought that because of this our room would have an increased amount of refreshments. 2 mugs and 2 glasses is NOT a reasonable amount when there are 4 guests staying. I then rang reception and they kindly brought us 2 more mugs, 2 more glasses and 6 more hot chocolate saches. I can not fault the cleanliness of our room and the lounges.
reviews.title: Very relaxing hotel - great staff.

reviews.text: A nice touch in the evening is the free milk & biscuits for the younger guests. The bar is also nice and I happily enjoyed a Shandy at 11PM! A late opening is great.
reviews.title: Nice hospitality
Several return visits
reviews.text: Breakfast was beautiful and the staff were so friendly. My father, who wasn't staying at the hotel, was allowed to dine with us and the manager said that he didn't have to pay extra.
Overall, I would recommend this hotel a great place to stay in & if you're going to Thorpe Park and want a cheaper hotel - BOOK HERE! It's only a 25minute journey....
reviews.title: Average Hotel, Unfair Pricing

reviews.text: I lead a group of 21 people who stayed at Holiday Inn Guildford last May and I can say we had very satisfactory stay. Not only is the hotel very clean and well-equipped, but the rooms are also large and quite comfortable.
reviews.title: Great service!

reviews.text: While our general experience was very good, I have to highlight the service we received. The front-desk staff was always friendly and helpful. Specially Kishore at the restaurant was kind enough to design special menus for our group member's requirements and always did it with a very good attitude. Our company organizes many events all over the world and I can confidently say that this kind of service is not easy to find.
reviews.title: Normal Holiday Inn

reviews.text: I will pleasantly recommend this hotel for leisure and business.
reviews.title: I didn't know it was school holidays

reviews.text: Recently stayed here as attending a party held in the hotel. Rooms fairly basic, but just what we expected from a Holiday Inn. Awakened next morning by a fire alarm, we never discovered the reason why. Drill carried out okay, however, seemed a little strange that the gathering point seemed to be right at the hotel doorway and not at a distance from the hotel in the car park.
reviews.title: Great for the price

reviews.text: Cannot comment on breakfast as it was not included in our rate and we declined the offer to pay for it.
reviews.title: Pricey
Visiting family
reviews.text: Like this hotel for its location just off the A3, very easy to find. Ample parking and efficient reception. Family room was a reasonable size with a sofa bed. All very clean but could do with more bathroom toiletries.

Staff were very courteous but a special mention for Chloe working in the bar/restaurant. She was vey friendly, attentive and seemed genuinely interested in how your day had been. We had breakfast included in our rate and it was quite good with a selection of hot and cold buffet. Lunch and evening meals were fine and we eat several times here.
reviews.title: Clean, nice room and great for one night

reviews.text: Never used the leisure facilities so can't comment.
reviews.title: Evening Buffett was horrid

reviews.text: We used taxis to get into the town centre at £10 each way including a tip. Much easier than driving and finding parking.
reviews.title: Great stay due to hotel Staff

reviews.text: Usual Holiday Inn standard and service and will definitely stay here again when visiting family in the area.
reviews.title: Rated on Ambience, Staff and rooms

reviews.text: Hotel is ok, nothing special, full of kid's running up and down the corridors, but it is school holidays. My gripe here is that you pay £90 corporate rate for room only, room is ok, standard hotel room but no iron or ironing board. Why do business hotels not provide this facility as standard. Gripe here is to get Wi-Fi you have to pay the extortionate rate of £5 for 1 hr or £10 for 5 hours. Anyway can’t write anymore, about to get cut off and don’t want to spend £5 again for an hour.
reviews.title: Rip off Wi-fi

reviews.text: Stayed here again for 3 nights for business but may family joined me.
reviews.title: another good stay

reviews.text: We stayed in a family room which had a large double bed, and a double bed pull-out sofa. The sofa-bed was incredibly soft and probably needs replacing, but the normal bed was very comfortable. One disappointing issue with the room is the lack of tv channels which is suprising these days.
reviews.title: By far the best Holiday Inn I have visited! Although I never got to sleep there :-(

reviews.text: We ate in the hotel 2 nights, mainly because my child ate free. She enjoyed the food but I felt that a there was a limited healthy choice for her each night and would have liked to have seen some salad available and a few less fried foods. We ordered from the menu and the food we had was very nice but very pricey for what it was and for the quantity.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, lovely staff

reviews.text: Breakfast was nice and plentiful, and although mine was paid for, we were able to have a discounted voucher for the additional breakfast.
reviews.title: good value weekend

description: Welcome to The Holiday Inn Guildford, a modern full-service hotel, close to Guildford Town Centre and only 29 miles from London with easy access via the M25/ A3 and by train. The hotel is located near the Guildford Business Parks & FIVE Exhibition Centre . The hotel offers 168 air conditioned bedrooms including accessible (4) & family rooms. The hotel has high speed internet access available throughout and WIFI in the public areas. Stay at the Holiday Inn Guildford hotel & enjoy breakfast, lunch & dinner in the Restaurant or have a 'light bite' in our Bar/Lounge. Kids eat, Stay free!* Holiday Inn Guildford is a Legoland hotel , and also close to other local attractions such as Chessington World of Adventures, Thorpe Park & Wisley Gardens. The Academy Conference Centre at the hotel is a leading Meetings venue in Guildford offering superb meeting rooms accommodating up to 180 delegates with extensive on-site car parking available. The hotel is also a premier Wedding venue in Guildford, Surrey. 'Spirit' at Holiday Inn Guildford is an excellent fully equipped health club with an indoor swimming pool, fitness studio and gym with a wide range of Beauty treatments available. *Terms & Conditions apply
